metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 23 axioms covering memory storage, retrieval, accessibility, associations, remembering, forgetting, and repression
metadata.notation: First-order logic with reified eventualities and memory operations

axioms.title: Definition of store
axioms.fol: (forall (a m) (if (and (agent a)(memory m a)) (forall (e c) (iff (store' e a c) (exists (e1 e2) (and (inFocus c a)(changeTo' e1 e2) (inm' e2 c m)(gen e1 e)))))))
axioms.english: An agent stores a concept in memory when there is a change from a state in which the concept is in focus but not in memory to one in which it is in memory

axioms.title: Definition of retrieve
axioms.fol: (forall (a m) (if (and (agent a)(memory m a)) (forall (e c) (iff (retrieve' e a c) (exists (e1 e2) (and (inm c m)(changeTo' e1 e2) (inFocus' e2 c a)(gen e1 e)))))))
axioms.english: To retrieve a concept from memory is to change from a state in which the concept is in memory and not in focus to one in which it is in focus

axioms.title: Store requires agency
axioms.fol: (forall (a c)(if (store a c)(agent a)))
axioms.english: Storing is an action by agents

axioms.title: Retrieve requires agency
axioms.fol: (forall (a c)(if (retrieve a c)(agent a)))
axioms.english: Retrieving is an action by agents

axioms.title: Memory entry requires storage
axioms.fol: (forall (e c m a) (if (and (inm' e c m)(memory m a)) (exists (e1)(and (store' e1 a c)(cause e1 e)))))
axioms.english: The only way for a concept to get into an agent's memory is for it to be stored

axioms.title: Memory concepts have accessibility
axioms.fol: (forall (m a c) (if (and (memory m a)(inm c m)) (exists (x) (accessibility x c m))))
axioms.english: Concepts in memory have an accessibility which is an element in a partial ordering

axioms.title: Accessibility requires memory
axioms.fol: (forall (x c m) (if (accessibility x c m) (exists (a) (memory m a))))
axioms.english: Accessibility is a function mapping a concept and an agent's memory into an element of a partial ordering

axioms.title: Accessibility is functional
axioms.fol: (forall (x1 x2 c m) (if (and (accessibility x1 c m)(accessibility x2 c m)) (equal x1 x2)))
axioms.english: Accessibility is a functional relationship - one concept in one memory has exactly one accessibility value

axioms.title: Accessibilities are in accessibility scale
axioms.fol: (forall (x c m a) (if (and (accessibility x c m)(memory m a)) (exists (s) (and (scale s)(inScale x s) (accessibilityScale s a)))))
axioms.english: Accessibilities are partially ordered; they are elements in the agent's accessibility scale

axioms.title: Accessibility scale constraint
axioms.fol: (forall (s a) (if (accessibilityScale s a) (and (agent a)(scale s))))
axioms.english: Accessibility scales belong to agents and are scales

axioms.title: Memory threshold existence
axioms.fol: (forall (m a s) (if (and (memory m a)(accessibilityScale s a)) (exists (x0) (and (memoryThreshold x0 a)(inScale x0 s)))))
axioms.english: For any given agent, there is an accessibility value below which concepts are not retrieved from memory - the memory threshold

axioms.title: Memory threshold definition
axioms.fol: (forall (m a s) (if (and (memory m a)(accessibilityScale s a)) (forall (x0) (iff (memoryThreshold x0 a) (forall (x1 c e e1) (if (and (accessibility x1 c m)(gts' e x1 x0 s) (retrieve' e1 a c)) (enable e e1)))))))
axioms.english: A concept's accessibility being above the memory threshold enables retrieval

axioms.title: Definition of accessible
axioms.fol: (forall (c a) (iff (accessible c a) (exists (m x1 s x0) (and (memory m a)(accessibility x1 c m) (accessibilityScale s a)(memoryThreshold x0 a) (lts x0 x1 s)))))
axioms.english: If a concept's accessibility is above the memory threshold, then it is accessible

axioms.title: Importance affects accessibility
axioms.fol: (forall (c1 c2 i1 i2 x1 x2 s1 s2 a) (if (and (importanceScale s1 a)(accessibilityScale s2 a) (importance i1 c1 a)(importance i2 c2 a) (accessibility x1 c1 a)(accessibility x2 c2 a) (lts i1 i2 s1)(etc)) (leqs x1 x2 s2)))
axioms.english: There is an at least defeasible monotonic relation between the importance of a concept and its accessibility

axioms.title: Definition of remind
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 c1 a c2) (iff (remind' e1 c1 a c2) (exists (e2 e3) (and (inFocus' e2 c1 a)(cause e2 e3)(retrieve' e3 a c2) (gen e3 e1)))))
axioms.english: One concept can remind an agent of another concept when the first concept being in focus causes the second to be remembered

axioms.title: Associated requires agent
axioms.fol: (forall (x y a) (if (associated x y a)(agent a)))
axioms.english: The relation associated requires an agent as third argument

axioms.title: Association symmetry
axioms.fol: (forall (x y a) (if (and (associated x y a)(etc))(associated y x a)))
axioms.english: The relation associated is defeasibly symmetric in x and y

axioms.title: Cause associates cause and effect
axioms.fol: (forall (a e1 e2 e3) (if (and (cause' e1 e2 e3)(believe a e1)) (associated e2 e3 a)))
axioms.english: Causes and effects are associated if the agent believes the causal relation

axioms.title: Implication associates antecedent and consequent
axioms.fol: (forall (a e1 e2 e3) (if (and (imply' e1 e2 e3)(believe a e1)) (associated e2 e3 a)))
axioms.english: Antecedents and consequents in implicative rules are associated if the agent believes the implication

axioms.title: Eventualities associate with arguments
axioms.fol: (forall (a e x e1) (if (and (believe a e1)(arg' e1 x e)) (associated e x a)))
axioms.english: Eventualities are associated with their arguments if the agent believes the argument relation

axioms.title: Focus raises accessibility of associated concepts
axioms.fol: (forall (c1 c2 a e e3) (if (and (associated c1 c2 a)(changeTo' e e3) (inFocus' e3 c1 a)) (exists (e0 e1 e2 x1 x2 s) (and (change' e0 e1 e2)(accessibility' e1 x1 c2 a) (accessibility' e2 x2 c2 a)(lts x1 x2 s) (accessibilityScale s a)(cause e e0)))))
axioms.english: A concept being in focus raises the accessibility of associated concepts

axioms.title: Definition of remember1
axioms.fol: (forall (c a) (iff (remember1 a c)(accessible a c)))
axioms.english: Remember1: the agent has the concept in memory and it is accessible, but not necessarily in focus

axioms.title: Definition of remember2
axioms.fol: (forall (c a) (iff (remember2 a c)(retrieve a c)))
axioms.english: Remember2: there has actually been a retrieval from memory

axioms.title: Definition of remember3
axioms.fol: (forall (c a) (iff (remember3 a c) (exists (e) (and (cause a e)(retrieve' e a c)))))
axioms.english: Remember3: the agent plays a causal role in the remembering

axioms.title: Definition of remember4
axioms.fol: (forall (c a) (iff (remember4 a c) (exists (e) (and (succeed a e)(retrieve' e a c)))))
axioms.english: Remember4: there is a distinct attempt to retrieve something from memory, and it succeeds

axioms.title: Remember2 implies remember1
axioms.fol: (forall (c a) (if (remember2 a c)(remember1 a c)))
axioms.english: Each sense of remembering implies the previous

axioms.title: Remember3 implies remember2
axioms.fol: (forall (c a) (if (remember3 a c)(remember2 a c)))
axioms.english: Each sense of remembering implies the previous

axioms.title: Remember4 implies remember3
axioms.fol: (forall (c a) (if (remember4 a c)(remember3 a c)))
axioms.english: Each sense of remembering implies the previous

axioms.title: Remember1 implies remember
axioms.fol: (forall (c a) (if (remember1 a c)(remember a c)))
axioms.english: All types of remembering are senses of remember

axioms.title: People can remember things
axioms.fol: (forall (a m c) (if (and (person a)(memory m a)(inm c m)(etc)) (exists (e s) (able a e s)(remember' e a c))))
axioms.english: Because people can cause concepts to be in focus and this may cause them to remember other concepts, people have an ability to remember things

axioms.title: Definition of forget1
axioms.fol: (forall (e a c) (iff (forget1' e a c) (exists (e1 e2) (and (changeFrom' e1 e2)(accessible' e2 c a) (gen e1 e)))))
axioms.english: To forget1 a concept is for the accessibility to change from being above the memory threshold to being below it

axioms.title: Forget1 negates remember1
axioms.fol: (forall (a c) (if (forget1 a c)(not (remember1 a c))))
axioms.english: If an agent forgets something in the forget1 sense, they do not remember it under any notion of remembering

axioms.title: Definition of forget2
axioms.fol: (forall (e a c) (iff (forget2' e a c) (exists (e1 e2) (and (retrieve' e1 a c)(goodFor e1 a)(not' e2 e1) (gen e2 e)))))
axioms.english: To forget2 is to not retrieve when such a retrieval would have been good for you in some way

axioms.title: Definition of forget3
axioms.fol: (forall (e a c) (iff (forget3' e a c) (exists (e1 e2 e3) (and (cause' e1 a e2)(changeFrom' e2 e3) (inFocus' e3 c a)(gen e1 e)))))
axioms.english: To forget3 is when the agent intentionally ceases to have the concept in focus

axioms.title: Focus enables action
axioms.fol: (forall (a e t e1) (if (and (agentOf a e)(atTime e t)(inFocus' e1 e a)) (exists (e2) (and (atTime' e2 e1 t)(enable e2 e)))))
axioms.english: If an agent is to do an event at time t, then that event being in the agent's focus of attention at time t enables the event

axioms.title: Definition of rememberTo
axioms.fol: (forall (a e) (iff (rememberTo a e) (exists (e1 t e2 e3 e4) (and (atTime' e1 e t)(goal e1 a)(agentOf a e) (retrieve' e2 a e1)(cause e2 e3)(atTime' e3 e4 t) (inFocus' e4 e1 a)))))
axioms.english: An agent remembers to do something if that action was part of their plan and retrieving it causes them to have that goal in focus at the designated time

axioms.title: Definition of repressed
axioms.fol: (forall (c a) (if (repressed c a) (exists (m) (and (memory m a)(inm c m)(not (accessible c a))))))
axioms.english: If a concept c is repressed for an agent a, then c is in a's memory but it is not accessible

axioms.title: Repressed concepts cause unhappiness
axioms.fol: (forall (a x) (if (and (repressed' e x a)(etc)) (exists (e0 e1 e2) (and (thinkOf' e1 a x)(unhappy' e2 a)(cause' e0 e1 e2) (cause e0 e)))))
axioms.english: If something is repressed, then it is probably because thinking about it causes one to be unhappy

conversion_notes.reified_predicates: Extensive use of primed predicates for memory operations: store', retrieve', remind', accessibility', inFocus', cause', changeTo', changeFrom', atTime', forget1', forget2', forget3', repressed', thinkOf', unhappy'
conversion_notes.defeasible_reasoning: 4 axioms use (etc) condition for defeasible reasoning: association symmetry (23.17), importance-accessibility relation (23.14), people's ability to remember (23.30), and repression causation (23.38)
conversion_notes.memory_theory: Comprehensive theory covering storage, retrieval, accessibility thresholds, associations, multiple senses of remembering/forgetting, and repression
conversion_notes.cross_references: References to concepts from other chapters: goals (Ch 28), scales (Ch 12), causality (Ch 15), envisioning (Ch 24), emotions (Ch 49)
conversion_notes.lexical_analysis: Chapter demonstrates systematic relationship between core theory predicates and natural language lexical items (remember1-4, forget1-3)

file_format_notes.axiom_extraction: All 38 numbered axioms (23.1-23.38) extracted from PDF
file_format_notes.fol_formatting: FOL expressions cleaned and standardized while preserving exact logical structure
file_format_notes.complexity_classification: Based on quantifier depth, logical structure complexity, and number of conjunctive conditions
file_format_notes.pattern_identification: Patterns categorized according to logical structure and theoretical role in memory framework
